intro: Eupatorium caaguazuense, commonly known as the Caaguazú eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Paraguay and parts of Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its foliage is aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The flowers, which bloom in late summer, attract various pollinators including bees and butterflies.
